episodeTitle: Don't Stop! Raise the Signal Fire of a Counterattack!
episodeTitleJapanese: 立ち止まるな！反撃の狼煙を上げろ！
episodeTitleRomanized: Tachitomaru na! Hangeki no noroshi o agero!
description: Kokoro contacts the Straw Hats via Den Den Mushi with crucial tactical information about accessing the Tower of Justice. The giants Kashii and Oimo join the battle after learning they were deceived by the World Government. Meanwhile, Luffy continues his fight with Blueno on the courthouse roof, while inside the Tower of Justice, Spandam gives Devil Fruits to Kaku and Kalifa, who consume them despite not knowing their powers.

events.title: Kokoro Contacts Straw Hats via Den Den Mushi
events.description: Kokoro uses Nami's baby Den Den Mushi to contact the Straw Hats with crucial tactical information she forgot to mention earlier. She explains how to access the Tower of Justice from the courthouse by activating levers on the top floor of the two towers flanking the courthouse, which will lower a connecting bridge.
events.significance: Provides the Straw Hats and their allies with vital tactical information for their assault on the Tower of Justice, enabling them to plan their approach to reach Robin and Franky. This communication demonstrates the coordination of the rescue effort.

quotes.text: To move the levers that exist on the top floor of the two towers will lower a bridge that connects the two buildings.
quotes.speaker: Kokoro
quotes.context: Kokoro explaining the mechanism to access the Tower of Justice

events.title: Chimney Reports Luffy's Location
events.description: Chimney takes the Den Den Mushi from Kokoro and informs Nami that she has seen Luffy on the rooftop of the courthouse, giving the crew vital information about their captain's whereabouts.
events.significance: Helps the Straw Hats understand where Luffy is in the battle and that he's already engaged with the enemy on the courthouse roof, coordinating their movements during the chaotic assault.

events.title: Just Eleven Jurymen Attack Gomorrah
events.description: The Just Eleven Jurymen, the strongest troops under Baskerville's command at Enies Lobby, attack Gomorrah with their chain weapons, knocking down the massive King Bull and allowing Marines to catch up with the Straw Hats' allies.
events.significance: Demonstrates the strength of Enies Lobby's elite forces and creates a crisis moment for the rescue team, showing that even their powerful allies like Gomorrah can be overwhelmed by the World Government's forces.

events.title: Sogeking Arrives with the Giants
events.description: After Gomorrah is knocked down, Sogeking (Usopp) makes a dramatic entrance riding on the shoulders of the giants Kashii and Oimo, bringing powerful reinforcements to the Straw Hats' side in the battle.
events.significance: Marks a turning point in the battle as the giants, who were previously guarding Enies Lobby's gates against the Straw Hats, have now become allies. Sogeking's arrival with these powerful reinforcements boosts morale and fighting power.

events.title: Giants Switch Sides After Learning the Truth
events.description: Kashii and Oimo explain that they switched sides after Usopp revealed the truth that their captains Dorry and Brogy were never captured. The World Government had lied to them for 50 years, and they now seek revenge for being deceived.
events.significance: Reveals the World Government's willingness to manipulate and deceive even those who serve them loyally. The giants' defection represents a loss of powerful defenders for Enies Lobby and demonstrates how the truth can turn allies into enemies.

events.title: Gomorrah Stands Despite Being Blinded
events.description: Despite being knocked down and having damaged his retina in battle (as translated by Chopper), Gomorrah courageously stands back up. He tells those riding him to hold on as he plans to charge to the courthouse, demonstrating his unwavering determination to help rescue Robin.
events.significance: Shows Gomorrah's loyalty and courage, willing to continue fighting even while blinded and injured. His determination inspires the Straw Hats' allies and demonstrates the deep bond between the King Bulls and their riders.

events.title: Gomorrah Reaches the Courthouse Courtyard
events.description: Gomorrah recklessly charges through Enies Lobby despite being blind, crashing through buildings along the way. He successfully reaches the courthouse courtyard before finally collapsing from his injuries and exhaustion.
events.significance: Gomorrah's sacrifice successfully delivers the Straw Hats' allies to the courthouse, bringing them one step closer to rescuing Robin. His collapse marks the end of his contribution to the battle but accomplishes his mission.

events.title: Luffy Continues Battle with Blueno
events.description: On the courthouse rooftop, Luffy continues his intense battle against CP9 member Blueno. This ongoing fight demonstrates Luffy's determination to reach Robin and his growth as he faces one of the World Government's elite assassins.
events.significance: This battle serves as a warm-up for Luffy before facing the stronger CP9 members and shows his development since entering the Grand Line. The fight also buys time for his allies to advance through Enies Lobby.

events.title: Blueno Demonstrates Doa Doa no Mi Abilities
events.description: Blueno showcases his Devil Fruit powers, the Doa Doa no Mi (Door-Door Fruit), which allows him to create doors through any surface including the air itself. He demonstrates the Kaiten Door (Revolving Door) technique, turning his opponent's face into a revolving door to disorient them.
events.significance: Reveals the full extent of Blueno's unusual Devil Fruit abilities, showing how versatile and creative Paramecia fruits can be. The Doa Doa no Mi's ability to create doors in the air and even on opponents demonstrates the strategic advantages it provides in combat.

quotes.speaker: Blueno
quotes.context: Blueno activating his Revolving Door technique on his opponent

events.title: Blueno's Air Door Ability
events.description: Blueno demonstrates his ability to create doors in the air itself, accessing a separate pocket dimension where he can hide, rest, and plan strategy during battle. This unique application of his Devil Fruit allows him tactical advantages in combat.
events.significance: Shows the strategic depth of the Doa Doa no Mi, as it's not just an offensive ability but also provides defensive and tactical options. The Air Door becomes a recurring element in Blueno's fighting style.

events.title: Spandam Presents Devil Fruits to Kaku and Kalifa
events.description: Inside the Tower of Justice, Spandam reveals two Devil Fruits and offers them to CP9 agents Kaku and Kalifa, who are the only members without Devil Fruit powers. Spandam admits he has no idea what these fruits are or what powers they grant.
events.significance: This is a pivotal moment that will fundamentally change Kaku and Kalifa's fighting capabilities. The mystery of unknown Devil Fruits adds tension, as neither Spandam nor the agents know what powers they'll gain, making this a gamble with permanent consequences.

events.title: Jabra Warns Against Eating the Devil Fruits
events.description: Jabra attempts to convince Kaku and Kalifa not to eat the Devil Fruits, trying to dissuade them from taking the risk. Despite his warnings about the permanent consequences and the disgusting taste, both agents decide to proceed.
events.significance: Highlights the permanent and serious nature of consuming a Devil Fruit, as well as the trust (or desperation) required to eat an unknown fruit. Jabra's concern shows that even among CP9, there's caution about Devil Fruits.

events.title: Kaku and Kalifa Consume Their Devil Fruits
events.description: Kaku and Kalifa simultaneously consume their respective Devil Fruits despite not knowing what powers they will gain. Both immediately comment on how disgusting the fruits taste, but the consumption is complete and irreversible. Kaku has eaten the Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Giraffe, while Kalifa has consumed the Awa Awa no Mi.
events.significance: This moment permanently changes Kaku and Kalifa's abilities and marks a major power-up for CP9. The consumption of these fruits will significantly impact the upcoming battles between CP9 and the Straw Hats. The fact that they ate unknown fruits shows their dedication to the mission and trust in Spandam's leadership.

events.title: Franky Family Splits to Activate Bridge Levers
events.description: Following Kokoro's instructions, the Franky Family members decide to split up and head to the two towers flanking the courthouse to activate the levers that will lower the bridge connecting to the Tower of Justice.
events.significance: Demonstrates the tactical coordination of the rescue operation and the Franky Family's commitment to helping save Robin and their boss Franky. Their mission to activate the levers is crucial for the Straw Hats to reach the Tower of Justice.

quotes.text: To move the levers that exist on the top floor of the two towers will lower a bridge that connects the two buildings.
quotes.speaker: Kokoro
quotes.context: Explaining the mechanism to access the Tower of Justice

themes.description: The episode explores how the World Government's deception of the giants for 50 years is revealed, turning loyal guards into enemies. This theme is contrasted with the Straw Hats' honest communication via Den Den Mushi as they coordinate their rescue effort.
themes.symbolism: The giants' defection symbolizes how truth can shatter even the most long-standing allegiances built on lies, while the Straw Hats' coordination shows the strength that comes from honest communication.

themes.description: Gomorrah's willingness to continue fighting despite being blinded shows the lengths to which allies will go to help rescue Robin. His sacrifice mirrors the determination of all the Straw Hats' allies at Enies Lobby.
themes.symbolism: Gomorrah charging blindly forward represents the leap of faith required in the rescue mission and the unwavering commitment of those who fight for their friends.

themes.description: Kaku and Kalifa's decision to consume unknown Devil Fruits represents the risks people take in pursuit of power. Their willingness to eat fruits with unknown abilities shows both their dedication and the gamble inherent in Devil Fruit consumption.
themes.symbolism: The unknown Devil Fruits represent the uncertainty and permanent consequences of choices made in pursuit of strength, as well as the irreversible nature of certain decisions.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the importance of coordination and communication in the rescue effort, with Kokoro's tactical information, the Franky Family's lever mission, and the various groups working together to breach Enies Lobby's defenses.
themes.symbolism: The bridge mechanism represents how different groups must work together to bridge the gap between where they are and where they need to be.

characterSpotlights.development: Gomorrah demonstrates incredible courage and loyalty by continuing to fight even after being blinded. His determination to deliver the Straw Hats' allies to the courthouse shows the depth of the bond between the King Bulls and those they serve.
keyActions: Gets knocked down by Just Eleven Jurymen
Stands back up despite being blinded
Charges recklessly through Enies Lobby
Successfully reaches the courthouse courtyard
Collapses from injuries after completing his mission

characterSpotlights.development: Kashii, along with Oimo, completes his transformation from enemy guard to ally after learning the truth about the World Government's deception. His arrival with Sogeking provides crucial reinforcements for the rescue effort.
keyActions: Arrives with Sogeking and Oimo as reinforcements
Explains how the World Government deceived them for 50 years
Commits to helping the Straw Hats get revenge on the government

characterSpotlights.development: Oimo mirrors Kashii's journey from enemy to ally, demonstrating how the revelation of truth can completely reverse allegiances. His partnership with Kashii shows the strength of their bond and their shared desire for revenge.
keyActions: Arrives with Sogeking and Kashii as reinforcements
Confirms the giants' decision to switch sides
Joins the battle against Enies Lobby forces

characterSpotlights.development: Kaku makes the momentous decision to consume an unknown Devil Fruit, showing his commitment to the mission and willingness to take risks for greater power. This decision will fundamentally change his fighting style and abilities.
keyActions: Receives a Devil Fruit from Spandam
Listens to Jabra's warnings but proceeds anyway
Consumes the Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Giraffe
Comments on the disgusting taste

characterSpotlights.development: Kalifa parallels Kaku's decision, choosing to consume an unknown Devil Fruit despite the risks and warnings. Her choice demonstrates her dedication to CP9 and her willingness to permanently alter herself for the mission.
keyActions: Receives a Devil Fruit from Spandam
Decides to eat the fruit despite Jabra's warnings
Consumes the Awa Awa no Mi
Reacts to the terrible taste of the Devil Fruit

characterSpotlights.development: Blueno showcases the full versatility of his Doa Doa no Mi, demonstrating both offensive techniques like Kaiten Door and defensive/tactical uses like Air Door. His battle with Luffy displays his experience and creativity as a CP9 agent.
keyActions: Continues battle with Luffy on the courthouse roof
Demonstrates Kaiten Door technique
Uses Air Door to create tactical advantages
Shows the versatility of the Door-Door Fruit

characterSpotlights.development: Kokoro proves her value to the rescue effort by providing crucial tactical information about accessing the Tower of Justice. Her knowledge and communication keep the various groups coordinated during the chaotic battle.
keyActions: Contacts the Straw Hats via Den Den Mushi
Explains the bridge mechanism to access the Tower of Justice
Asks Nami to keep monitoring the Den Den Mushi for updates
quotes: To move the levers that exist on the top floor of the two towers will lower a bridge that connects the two buildings.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime removed the manga scene where Baskerville explicitly summons the Just Eleven Jurymen. In the anime, they simply appear without this establishing moment.
The manga explicitly shows CP9 gathered in Rob Lucci's quarters when Spandam presents the Devil Fruits. The anime only implies this location through visual context without making it explicit.

trivia.fact: This episode features an animation error where Nami's Perfect Clima-Tact is depicted with four bulbs instead of the correct three bulbs.
Episode 271 adapts manga chapters 384 (pages 8-19) and 385 (pages 2-15), covering approximately 1.5 chapters worth of content.
The Devil Fruits that Kaku and Kalifa eat in this episode won't have their names or powers fully revealed until later episodes, maintaining the mystery for viewers.
This is one of the last episodes to feature both an opening and ending theme, as Adventure World ends at episode 278, after which One Piece wouldn't have ending themes for 17 years.
The Kaiten Door technique that Blueno uses is one of the more creative and unusual Devil Fruit applications in the series, turning an opponent's face into a revolving door.
Episode 271 aired on July 9, 2006 in Japan, during the peak of the Enies Lobby arc, which is considered one of the best arcs in One Piece.
